name: Stream Temperature
functionStatement: Shade, solar input, and groundwater keep temperature and light within natural ranges for stream metabolism and dissolved oxygen.
descriptionMarkdown: Stays within acceptable bounds for local aquatic life, rarely exceeding stress thresholds.
howToMeasureMarkdown: Pull historical evidence or GIS data from public sources on temperature data such as USGS NWIS and EPA Water Quality Portal. In absence of data sources, use riparian shading as a surrograte based on GIS data and aerial photogrammetry

inputs.label: Stream Temperature
inputs.helpMarkdown: USGS NWIS and/or EPA Water Quality Portal water temperature data (where available); NorWeST modeled temperatures (where available); Riparian shading proxy in absence of data sources

levels.label: Good
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Good: Rarely surpasses local standard or typical seasonal maxima for the stream type. (Suggested index range 0.70-1.0)

levels.label: Fair
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Fair: Slightly exceeds thresholds occasionally. (Suggested index range 0.40-0.69)

levels.label: Poor
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Poor: Frequently near or above thresholds. / Consistently high or potentially lethal temperatures. (Suggested index range 0.0-0.39)

levels.label: Strongly Disagree
levels.criteriaMarkdown:
Observation: Daily exceedance and several events approaching lethal levels.
Criteria: Consistently high or lethal temperatures.

levels.label: Disagree
levels.criteriaMarkdown:
Observation: Repeated warm afternoons near or over the threshold each week.
Criteria: Frequent near or over threshold.

levels.label: Agree
levels.criteriaMarkdown:
Observation: Occasional brief exceedances during heat waves.
Criteria: Slightly exceeds threshold occasionally.

levels.label: Strongly Agree
levels.criteriaMarkdown:
Observation: Logger record shows summer highs below local standard. Small diel range.
Criteria: Rarely surpasses local standard. For screening, <20 C in coldwater or <28 C in warmwater.

references: USGS NWIS and/or EPA Water Quality Portal water temperature data (where available)
NorWeST modeled stream temperature products (where available).
